div.p: Large language models (LLMs) could transform education, scientific discovery, and more. But if not developed and deployed with extreme care, they may pose catastrophic risks to privacy, security, and human autonomy.
There are three different proposals under consideration. They have different attributes, including safety and control, development speed and public trust.
You must persuade the other player of your preferred proposal.
You have certain preferences over the attributes. (The other player is given similar, but possibly opposing, preferences.)

ul.li: You feel indifferent to development speed.
You feel indifferent to public trust.

div.p: The proposals will have the following effects:

ul.li: will have no effect on public trust

div.div: What do you know about the proposals?
Proposal A will increase public trust. Proposal B will increase safety and control and will have no effect on public trust. Proposal C will increase safety and control and will decrease public trust.
How do you feel about the attributes?
I dislike safety and control, I dislike development speed and I dislike public trust.
Proposal A will decrease safety and control. Proposal C will increase development speed.
Proposal A will decrease safety and control. Proposal C will increase development speed.
